method.name: client_id
method.description: <para>Optional. The Discord application ID for your game. Defaults to the value set by <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ad452335c06b28be0406dab824acccc49" kindref="member">Client::SetApplicationId</ref>. </para>

method.name: scopes
method.description: <para>Scopes is a space separated string of the oauth scopes your game is requesting. </para> <para>Most games should just pass in <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a71499da752fbdc2d4326ae0fd36c0dd1" kindref="member">Client::GetDefaultCommunicationScopes</ref> or <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a7648bd1d2f7d9a86ebd0edb8bef12b5c" kindref="member">Client::GetDefaultPresenceScopes</ref> which will include these scopes, respectively: <computeroutput>openid sdk.social_layer</computeroutput> or <computeroutput>openid sdk.social_layer_presence</computeroutput></para> <para><computeroutput>sdk.social_layer</computeroutput> and <computeroutput>sdk.social_layer_presence</computeroutput> automatically expand to include all the necessary scopes for the integration.</para> <para>You can pass in additional scopes if you need to, but as a general rule you should only request the scopes you actually need, and the user will need to grant access to those additional scopes as well. </para>
